newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE wheat mixed with new crop hit by stg.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE wheat mixed with new crop hit by stg.

text.p: LIFFE wheat ended tightly mixed, with a small gain on old crop, while new crop came down, hit by the strength of sterling.
Activity was light, with January busiest. It last traded 0.15 stg lower at 88.10 stg, on volume of 135 lots, out of a total 282.

The new crop was hit by sterling, traders said. As the UK currency went up to a five year high against the German mark, January went to a low of 85.75 stg, but it came back up as sterling eased later.
July bucked the new crop trend, ending 0.25 stg higher at 81.50. but July volume was just 9 lots.
Volume on barley was 25 lots, 15 on January, which last traded 0.65 stg lower at 85.75 stg.
Physical market traders reported little activity, with feed wheat done for July delivery to West Norfolk at 85.00 stg.
